        public Strongback.Configurator recordDuration(int numberOfSeconds)
        Set the estimated number of seconds that the data recorder will capture. This is used to estimate by the data recorder to optimize any resources it uses.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSeconds - the estimated number of seconds of recorded data; must be non-negative
        Returns:
        this configurator so that methods can be chained together; never null

      • useExecutionTimerMode

        public Strongback.Configurator useExecutionTimerMode(Strongback.Configurator.TimerMode mode)
        Use the specified wait mode for Strongback's executor. This wait mode determines whether the executor's thread loops, sleeps, or parks until the period has elapsed.
        Parameters:
        mode - the desired wait mode; may not be null
        Returns:
        this configurator so that methods can be chained together; never null
        See Also:
        useExecutionPeriod(long, TimeUnit)

      • useExecutionPeriod

        public Strongback.Configurator useExecutionPeriod(long interval,
                                                  TimeUnit unit)
        Use the specified execution rate for Strongback's executor. The default execution rate is 5 milliseconds.

        The clock that Strongback is configured to use will also affect the precision of the execution rate: the FPGA clock will likely support rates down to around a few milliseconds, whereas the system clock may only support rates of 10-15 milliseconds. Therefore, this method does not currently allow sub-microsecond intervals.

        Parameters:
        interval - the interval for calling all registered Executables; must be positive
        unit - the time unit for the interval; may not be null
        Returns:
        this configurator so that methods can be chained together; never null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if unit is TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS or TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS
        See Also:
        useExecutionTimerMode(TimerMode)

      • reportExcessiveExecutionPeriods

        public Strongback.Configurator reportExcessiveExecutionPeriods(LongConsumer handler)
        Every time the executor takes longer than the execution period to execute each interval, report this to the given handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - the receiver for notifications of excessive execution times
        Returns:
        this configurator so that methods can be chained together; never null
